reporter_caption.center: AMSOUTH BANK v. FLORIDA D.O.R., 1D03-1131 (Fla.App. 1 Dist. 2-23-2004)

caption.center: AMSOUTH BANK, an Alabama corporation, as successor to AMSOUTH BANK OF
FLORIDA, a Florida corporation, Appellant, v. FLORIDA DEPARTMENT OF
REVENUE, an agency of the State of Florida, Appellee.

court.center: District Court of Appeal of Florida, First District.

opinion.posture: An appeal from the Circuit Court for Leon County, Janet E. Ferris, Judge.
opinion.attorneys:
David E. Otero, Peter O. Larsen and J. Riley Williams of Akerman Senterfitt, Jacksonville, for Appellant.
Charles J. Crist, Jr., Attorney General and Charles Catanzaro, Assistant Attorney General, Tallahassee, for Appellee.
opinion.opinion_text:
AFFIRMED.
BOOTH, VAN NORTWICK AND LEWIS, JJ., CONCUR.
NOT FINAL UNTIL TIME EXPIRES TO FILE MOTION FOR REHEARING AND DISPOSITION THEREOF IF FILED.
